work.name: Microsoft Research Cambridge
work.summary: Contributed to the development of a cutting-edge optical transmission system. Conducted experiments to comprehensively characterize system performance under diverse operating conditions. Implemented a custom digital signal processing pipeline, which included equalisation techniques to optimize signal quality and enhance distance reach. Demonstrated strong communication and teamwork skills through collaboration with research scientists and presentation of findings.
highlights: Optical system design, digital signal processing, programming

volunteer.summary: Part of a team of postgraduate students making sure students living in Aston Student Village are receiving the pastoral and welfare support they need.

education.summary: My research focused on developing model-driven deep learning schemes to mitigate transmission impairments in optical fibre links. The proposed algorithms are power-efficient and amenable to parallelisation, offering a potential solution for integrating digital nonlinearity equalisation into future transceivers.
